bibdata.title: IEEE Standard for Health Informatics
Point-of-care medical device communication
Part 10201: Domain Information Model -- Redline
IEEE Standard for Health Informatics - Point-of-care medical device communication - Part 10201: Domain Information Model -- Redline
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std 11073-10201-2018 (Revision of IEEE Std 11073-10201-2004) - Redline

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: Within the context of the ISO/IEEE 11073 family of standards for point-of-care medical device communication, an abstract, object-oriented domain information model that specifies the structure of exchanged information, as well as the events and services that are supported by each type of object, is provided in this standard. All data structure elements are specified using abstract syntax (ASN.1) and may be applied to many different implementation technologies, transfer syntaxes, and application service models. Core subjects include medical, alert, system, patient, control, archival, communication, and extended services. Model extensibility is supported, and a conformance model and statement template is provided.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
